wikipedia_page.main: James Farish Malcolm Fawcett (born 1856) was an English cavalry officer of the 5th Lancers. He was also an entomologist who specialised in Lepidoptera.

response: Notable lepidopterologists who did many studies on this genus included Julius Röber, J. Malcolm Fawcett, George B. Johnson and Henry Rowland-Brown.
Taveta is a genus of moths of the family Erebidae. The genus was erected by J. Malcolm Fawcett in 1916.
* Caroline Agar-Ellis (1865–1891), who married Lt.-Col. J. Malcolm Fawcett, of Peckleton House, Hinckley, in 1888.
